titleStmt.title: letter from William Plomer to Leonard Woolf, 23 February 1931: a machine readable transcription

bibl.title: Letter from William Plomer to Leonard Woolf, 23 February 1931

div.p:
Since getting my MSmanuscript
back from the typist I have come
(not unaided) to the conclusion
that it is in many ways a
remarkably bad book. At the
same time, it has its virtues. I
propose, therefore, to set to work
at once and remake it. I have
every hope that it will be
ready in time for publication
in the autumn. In the
meanwhile, would you, I wonder,
feel at all inclined, as I am
in need of money, to make
me an advance upon it?

closer.seg:
I fancy the present 170,000 words
will boil down to half that number.
